intro: Suessenguthia vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas's suessenguthia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the undergrowth of tropical forests. Suessenguthia vargasii is often found growing on trees or rocks, showcasing its adaptability to diverse microhabitats.
